Description: Ostracon (?), fragment of the shoulder and neck section, with one handle surviving, of a red-brown pottery amphora with ribbed body, the interior is partly covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of one red-painted Coptic character, writ large.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394479) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394479)
